title: How to Knit Hats for the Innocent Drinks Big Knit

steps.headline: Cast on 28 stitches in DK yarn with 3.25mm needles.
Alternate knit and purl rows for around 16 rows.
Knit two stitches together along two rows, so that you have 7 stitches left.
Cut the yarn with a long tail, and use a yarn needle to thread it through the remaining open stitches.
steps.description: Pull it tight and then sew up the side of the hat.

steps.headline: Make a pompom for the top and sew it on.
Try some interesting variations - some people have posted patterns for crochet hats or themed hats online.
steps.description: The patterns page on the Innocent website has ideas for stripy hats and a ladybird hat.

steps.headline: Repeat until you're fed up of making tiny hats or your yarn stash has run out.
Put them all in an envelope and address it to The Big Knit, Fruit Towers, The Goldhawk Estate, Brackenbury Road, London, W6 0BA, UK.
steps.description: Write your name, address and the number of hats on the back of the envelope.

steps.headline: Get involved with other Big Knitters through the Facebook group or the Ravelry group.

steps.headline: Go out to Sainsburys' in November, if you can, to peruse the collection of hats on display!

text: Cast on 28 stitches in DK yarn with 3.25mm needles.  Knit for two rows.  Alternate knit and purl rows for around 16 rows.  Knit two stitches together along two rows, so that you have 7 stitches left.  Cut the yarn with a long tail, and use a yarn needle to thread it through the remaining open stitches. Pull it tight and then sew up the side of the hat. Make a pompom for the top and sew it on.  Try some interesting variations - some people have posted patterns for crochet hats or themed hats online. The patterns page on the Innocent website has ideas for stripy hats and a ladybird hat. Repeat until you're fed up of making tiny hats or your yarn stash has run out.  Put them all in an envelope and address it to The Big Knit, Fruit Towers, The Goldhawk Estate, Brackenbury Road, London, W6 0BA, UK. Write your name, address and the number of hats on the back of the envelope. Get involved with other Big Knitters through the Facebook group or the Ravelry group. There's a Flickr group for displaying your Innocent photos. Go out to Sainsburys' in November, if you can, to peruse the collection of hats on display!
